page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY - S.DOWNS
page.content: The S.Downs has a long history stretching back to the far off days of prehistoric man & much of interest remains for the archaeologists to discover about their way of life. Traces of early settlements along the ancient paths on top of the downs show signs of round huts surrounded by banks & ditches with banked enclosures for animals nearby. Many have now been ploughed over, but their sites are marked on older maps as "tumuli". At least 4 such sites can be found on the downs between Heyshott & Graffham. Later, people made settlements lower down the southern slopes. They surrounded their huts with square fields outlined by lynchets, or banks, which can still often be identified & are marked on maps as "Field systems". e.g.at the S.E.edge of sq.8. cont. page l5
